conclusion: Problem involves shadows cast by four objects labeled A, B, C, and D.
Objects casting shadows: toilet paper roll (C), cake on plate (B), tall thin object (A), circular ring (D).
Question asks how shadows will change when light source moves to back right.
Current setup: light source above, casting shadows directly downwards.
Shadow A is from the tall, thin object.
Shadow B is from the cake on the plate.
Shadow C is from the toilet paper roll.
Shadow D is from the circular ring.
If light source moves to back right, shadows will shift based on new light direction.
Shadow A will move to the left and forward relative to its current position.
Shadow B will shift towards the front left when light moves to back right.
Shadow C will shift towards the front left.
Shadow D will shift towards the front left.
For tall thin object (A), shadow will become longer when light moves to back right.
For cake on plate (B), shadow might not change much in length but will shift direction.
